description: First floor rear extension and loft extension
decision_conditions:
<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The proposal, by reason of its rearward
projection and siting, would be overbearing, visually obtrusive and would be
detrimental to the amenities of the neighbouring occupiers at No.17 </span><span style="line-height: 107%;">Sudbury Court Drive</span><span style="line-height: 107%;">, </span><span style="line-height: 107%;">resulting in an undue loss of outlook and visual
amenity, contrary to Policy DM1 B (a), DM1 C, DM1 D (d),&nbsp;(e) and (f) of
the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant
provisions of the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential
Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>

<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed first floor rear extension by
reason of its excessive width and overall bulk and lack of set down from the
main roof would fail to provide a proportionate, balanced, subordinate and
harmonious addition to the host dwellinghouse, and would result in an overly
dominant, obtrusive, and incongruous form of development that would subsume the
rear elevation of the host property, and would fail to respect the character
and appearance of the host dwellinghouse, neighbouring properties and the
prevailing pattern of development in the locality contrary to the high quality
design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3
(D(1) and (11)) of The&nbsp; London Plan
(2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A, DM1
B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan
(2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design
Guide (2010).<span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
